formatting functions

formatting functions to use with lsmeans objects

format_pvalue(x)

format_double(x, digits = 3)

format_integer(x)

format_default(x)

Arguments

x
the vector to format
digits
number of digits after the decimal point

extends

Pour creer une nouvelle fonction de formatage, il faut une fonction qui ne prend qu'un argument (un vecteur) et qui renvoie une chaine de caracteres de meme taille que le vecteur d'entree.

Examples

format_pvalue( runif(10))
#>  [1] "* 0.081"  "0.834"    "0.601"    "0.157"    "** 0.007" "0.466"   
#>  [7] "0.498"    "0.290"    "0.733"    "0.773"   
#> 

format_percent <- function(x)
  ifelse( is.na(x), "", paste0(formatC(x*100, format = "f", digits = 1 ), "%" ) )
format_percent( runif(10))
#>  [1] "87.5%" "17.5%" "3.4%"  "32.0%" "40.2%" "19.6%" "40.4%" "6.4%"  "38.9%"
#> [10] "97.6%"
#> 
format_double( runif(10))
#>  [1] "0.290" "0.678" "0.735" "0.196" "0.981" "0.742" "0.051" "0.530" "0.696"
#> [10] "0.689"
#> 
format_integer( rnorm(10, 3))
#>  [1] "1" "2" "3" "4" "2" "3" "3" "2" "4" "5"
#> 
format_integer( rnorm(10, 3))
#>  [1] "3" "2" "3" "2" "1" "4" "3" "3" "5" "3"
#>
